meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by parataxis, a grammatical structure in which coordinate clauses or phrases are arranged in sequence without subordination.
meanings.sent1: The paratactical style of writing presents ideas in a straightforward manner.
meanings.sent2: Her paratactical approach to storytelling made the plot easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The paratactical sentences flowed like a gentle stream, each one leading to the next.
meanings.sent4: His paratactical speech was like a string of pearls, each clause shining on its own.
meanings.sent5: The paratactical structure of the essay was as clear as a cloudless sky.

meanings.definition: Involving or using parataxis in writing or speech.
meanings.sent1: The paratactical sentences in the poem were short and impactful.
meanings.sent2: She preferred a paratactical writing style for her essays.
meanings.sent3: The paratactical dialogue in the play kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent4: His paratactical storytelling was like a series of snapshots capturing moments.
meanings.sent5: The paratactical structure of the speech was as direct as a arrow's flight.
